title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)) and Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule 3
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) (Amendment) (No.1) (Earnings Disregard) 
Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations 

(Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007 to 2021 shall be 
construed together as one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007 to 2022. 

the Social Welfare 

and 

Commencement

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)) and Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule 3
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation–
text_raw:
2. These Regulations come into operation– 

(a) 

in so far as they relate to disability allowance, on 2 June 2021, 
and 

(b) 

in so far as they relate to blind pension, on 4 June 2021. 

Earnings disregard — supplementary welfare allowance

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)) and Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule 3
heading: 3. Article 33 (amended by article 3 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
3. Article 33 (amended by article 3 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance (amendment) (No. 1) (S.I. No. 41 of 2019)) 
of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance) 
Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 412 of 2007) are amended by the substitution of 
“€140” for “€120”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

24 May, 2022. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd August, 2022.

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)) and Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule 3
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

Following from Budget 2021, the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 8) (Earnings Disregard) (S.I. No. 78 
of 2021) provided for an increase of €20, from €120 to €140, in the weekly 
earnings disregard in the case of recipients of Disability Allowance and Blind 
Pension. The weekly earnings disregard came into effect from 2 June 2021 in 
the case of Disability Allowance and from 4 June 2021 in the case of Blind 
Pension. 

Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule 3 of the Social Welfare Consolidation 
Act of 2005 provides that where an earnings disregard is availed of by a 
claimant of Disability Allowance or Blind Pension, the disregard will also be 
taken into account in determining their entitlement to supplements, such as 
Rent Supplement, under the Supplementary Welfare Allowance (SWA) 
Scheme. 

These Regulations amend article 33 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007, to reflect the earlier 
increase provided for in the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments 
and Control) (Amendment) (No. 8) (Earnings Disregard) (S.I. No. 78 of 2021), 
to increase by €20 (from €120 to €140), the weekly earnings disregard for the 
purposes of Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule 3 of the Act. As with the 
earlier Regulations, the increase in the weekly earnings disregard apply from 2 
June 2021 in the case of Disability Allowance and from 4 June 2021 in the case 
of Blind Pension. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [401]
